title: Earth Processes: Weathering and Erosion

vocab.definition: The process of breaking down rocks into smaller pieces
The process of moving weathered rock and soil from one place to another
The process of dropping off sediment in a new location
Small pieces of rock, sand, and soil that have been moved by water or wind
A natural feature of Earth's surface, like mountains, valleys, or rivers

teachingNotes: Use models and demonstrations to show how weathering and erosion shape the landscape. Show examples of different landforms and discuss how they were formed over time.
